db:abstract.db:para: The Qt OpenGL module offers classes that make it easy to use OpenGL in Qt applications.

db:article.db:para: The Qt OpenGL module offers classes that make it easy to use OpenGL in Qt applications.

db:listitem.db:para: The QGL namespace specifies miscellaneous identifiers used in the Qt OpenGL module.
The QGLContext class encapsulates an OpenGL rendering context.
The QGLFormat class specifies the display format of an OpenGL rendering context.
The QGLWidget class is a widget for rendering OpenGL graphics.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description

db:warning.db:para: Apart from the QGLWidget class, this module should not be used anymore for new code. Please use the corresponding OpenGL classes in Qt Gui.

db:section.db:para: OpenGL is a standard API for rendering 3D graphics. OpenGL only deals with 3D rendering and provides little or no support for GUI programming issues. The user interface for an OpenGL application must be created with another toolkit, such as Cocoa on the Mac OS X platform, Microsoft Foundation Classes (MFC) under Windows, or Qt on both platforms.

db:note.db:para: OpenGL is a trademark of Silicon Graphics, Inc. in the United States and other countries.

db:section.db:para: The Qt OpenGL module makes it easy to use OpenGL in Qt applications. It provides an OpenGL widget class that can be used just like any other Qt widget, except that it opens an OpenGL display buffer where you can use the OpenGL API to render the contents.

The Qt OpenGL module is implemented as a platform-independent Qt/C++ wrapper around the platform-dependent GLX (version 1.3 or later), WGL, or AGL C APIs. Although the basic functionality provided is very similar to Mark Kilgard's GLUT library, applications using the Qt OpenGL module can take advantage of the whole Qt API for non-OpenGL-specific GUI functionality.
